title: Obama: The United States spends more on military forces than the next eight countries combined.
text: President Barack Obama defended American power in the face of attacks from critics who say that the United States has become a weak player on the national stage. We wondered whether the latest statement on military spending was accurate, and therefore decided to verify it. We found that Obama's claim is on the field. A set of international military expenditure figures comes from the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute, a think tank. The Institute has maintained an electronic database of military expenditures since 1988 for more than 170 countries. In its calculations, the United States spends more than the following seven countries together. In 2014, the last year available, the United States led the world in military spending by $610 billion, representing 34 per cent of the world total, which the Institute found. The calculation of military expenditures for global comparisons is a challenge in nature, partly because of the lack of a common definition of what constitutes military expenditure. Moreover, the country ' s expenditures are not necessarily fully linked to its military capabilities. While Obama has a point that US defence spending is much larger than every other country, spending under his presidency has declined. Public expenditure on national security includes the Pentagon budget, as well as expenditure by other agencies, such as the Ministry of Energy ' s work on nuclear weapons. Expenditure increased in 2010 and 2011, but has declined annually for four years since then by a cumulative 15 per cent. Expenditure on national security accounted for 20.1 per cent of the federal budget in 2010, but reached 15.9 per cent in 2015. There are two main reasons for the underexpenditure.
